item.title: GrapheneOS
item.description: Setup GrapheneOS Web Installer Contacts Export Google contacts Main NordVPN APK or use NordPVN with OpenVPN for Android using OpenVPN config files Mullvad VPN. Download from F-Droid DeGoogle Google Play Store Droid-ify: F-Droic client. Download from F-Droid or GitHub Auorora Store: Download from F-Droid. GitHub Repo An unofficial, FOSS client to Google Play Works with or without Google Play Services Maps Still trying to figure out the best alternative. OpenStreetMap OsmAnd Does not have live traffic ‼️ But you can overlay Google traffic data Organic Maps Waze Live Map ‼️ Waze is owned by Google Proton Mail: web download, Play Store Proton Drive Photos Ente Photos Fossify Gallery from F-Droid NewPipe: Ad-free YouTube app Social Media reddit Use a Redlib instance Or patch an app with ReVanced Twitter/X: Use a Nitter instance Instagram: Barinsta (formerly InstaGrabber) Other Tools Gboard: Keyboard from Google but you can disable network access Preferences -> Number row -> Enabled Preferences -> Long press for symbols -> Enabled Preferences -> Key Long press delay -> 100 ms Private Lock from F-Droid.

item.title: League of Legends
item.description: Settings Borderless window 25 Settings for Season 14 Game Enable “Clamp cast target location within max range” Disable “Move camera on revive” Quick cast “Quick Cast All” (Hotkeys) Rebind normal cast to Shift+<ability> so you can still see the range indicator (Hotkeys) Attack move Enable “Attack move on cursor” (Game) Enable “Show Attack Range” (Interface) Target Champions Only (Hotkeys) Treat “Target Champions Only” as a toggle (Game) F key cycling Rebind “Select Ally 1-4” to Z, X, C, V (Hotkeys) Chat Enable “Show timestamps” Set “Change Chat Visibility” to “Same Team” In every game type /mute all and /mutepings all Interface Set “HUD Scale” to 0 Set “Map Scale” to 50-65 Enable “Show Loss of Control UI” Set “Show Names Above Healthbar” to “Champion Name” Enable “Champion highlight on camera center” Enable “Enable Line Missile display” Enable “Show Spell costs” Disable “Show Off-Screen Pings” Set “Emote Buuble Display” to Off Set “Emote Size” to Small Enable “Mute enemy Emotes” Set “Eternals Milestone Display” to “None” Video Disable “Wait for Vertical Sync” (Video) “Effects Quality” should be at least Medium “Character Quality” should be at least Medium “Environment Quality” should be Low or High because there is no difference between Low vs Medium or High vs Very High “Shadow Quality” can be turned Off Enable “Hide eye candy” Enable “Color blind mode” Sound Disable “Music Volume” Disable “Voice Volume” Disable “Ambience Volume” Lower “Ping Volume” and “Announcer Volume” lower than your “Sound FX Volume”

item.title: Butter Mochi
item.description: About Recipe copied from Hawaiian Electric’s page for posterity. Demonstrated by: Helen Kuoha-Torco. Aloha Festivals - August 16, 2003. Ingredients: 1 lb mochiko (Japanese glutinous rice flour) 3 cups sugar 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder 4 eggs, beaten 2 teaspoons vanilla extract 1/2 cup butter, melted 1 can (13.5 oz) coconut milk 1 can (14.5 oz) evaporated milk Directions: Preheat electric oven to 350°F. Grease a 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan or two 8 x 8 x 2-inch pans.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: echo "Hello World!" Welcome to my blog and first ever blog post! Why I’m Blogging To share my knowledge, thoughts, and ideas with others. To get better at writing and expressing said thoughts and ideas. As a link hoarder, I want somewhere to dump my links (this will be in my Collections page). Learn Hugo, HTML/CSS, and maybe some JavaScript. Topics Command Line Tools. Things like vim, tmux, git, etc. Scripting.
